body: To add binary follow this concept. 0 + 0 = 0, 0 + 1 = 1 and 1 + 1 = 11 (this is saying one one not eleven).

JavaScript is a perfect starter language for you.

A good framework to use for CSS is tailwind, although I personally like using React and vanilla css
YouTube is sometimes the best teacher, try to target a specific target then find the linking technologies.
You won't learn everything at once, don't stress out and overload yourself. A good pace wins the race.
Discord was built with a JavaScript front-end and a Python back-end, I don't see why not.
You can stick with UX/Front-end design if you want but you'll never get into the nitty gritty of programming.
You could try getting a certification if you don't like self-learning.
Cookies are small pieces of data that are stored on a user's computer by a website. They contain info like user login, statuses, shopping cart items etc.
